channel.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
channel.description: Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee speak to experts on economics, finance, investment and international relations.
channel.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
channel.itunes:subtitle: Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee speak to experts on economics, finance, investment and international relations.
channel.itunes:summary: Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee speak to experts on economics, finance, investment and international relations.

item.title: Russo: Cost that make products are lower than a few years ago
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Russo: Cost that make products are lower than a few years ago
item.itunes:summary: Edward Jones Analyst Jack Russo says investors want to own consumer staples so bad they don't even care about growing sales as long as they are growing earnings. He speaks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance.
item.itunes:keywords: business, podcasts, Tom Keene, Michael McKee, economy podcast

item.title: Oja: Wells Fargo had traditional strong long growth
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Oja: Wells Fargo had traditional strong long growth
item.itunes:summary: S&P Bank Analyst Erik Oja discusses banks and how traditional banking is doing fine for these companies. He discusses the different banks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance.
item.itunes:keywords: business, podcasts, Tom Keene, Michael McKee, economy podcast

item.title: Derman: Stocks aren't going to behave the way they should
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Derman: Stocks aren’t going to behave the way they should
item.itunes:summary: Columbia University's Emanuel Derman weighs in on markets not behaving the way they should and being controlled by the central banks on Bloomberg Surveillance with Tom Keene and Michael McKee.
item.itunes:keywords: business, podcasts, Tom Keene, Michael McKee, economy podcast

item.title: Kelly: Pricing of central banks are completely out of whack
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Kelly: Pricing of central banks are completely out of whack
item.itunes:summary: JP Morgan's David Kelly says global nominal GDP is pretty slow, there is low inflation and there is no strong growth. However, the global economy is still moving forward. He speaks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance.
item.itunes:keywords: business, podcasts, Tom Keene, Michael McKee, economy podcast

item.title: Hintz: Headwind is on the energy side
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Hintz: Headwind is on the energy side
item.itunes:summary: Stern School of Business Professor Brad Hintz says ROE's are low because if you're not taking any risk you're not taking any losses. He speaks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance.
item.itunes:keywords: business, podcasts, Tom Keene, Michael McKee, economy podcast

item.title: Zandi: We'll get another good year in overall consumer spending
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Zandi: We’ll get another good year in overall consumer spending
item.itunes:summary: Moody's Analytics' Mark Zandi speaking on the American consumer and spending growth where retail is just half of it and spending on services is quite strong. He speaks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance.
item.itunes:keywords: business, podcasts, Tom Keene, Michael McKee, economy podcast

item.title: York: Lower for longer range trading in 40's and 50's
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: York: Lower for longer range trading in 40’s and 50’s
item.itunes:summary: WoodMac Oil analyst Skip York says we have been in a fifty dollar range approaching fifteen months and that means it's two years where oil prices are half of where they were before they are corrected and the market typically corrects faster than that. He speaks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance.
item.itunes:keywords: business, podcasts, Tom Keene, Michael McKee, economy podcast

item.title: Straszheim: reports of death of Chinese economy exaggerated
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Straszheim: reports of death of Chinese economy exaggerated
item.itunes:summary: Evercore's Donald Straszheim weighs in on an improving Chinese economy on Bloomberg Surveillance with Tom Keene and Michael McKee.
item.itunes:keywords: business, podcasts, Tom Keene, Michael McKee, economy podcast

item.title: Bianco: 70% of companies will beat earnings expectations
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Bianco: 70% of companies will beat earnings expectations
item.itunes:summary: Bianco Research's Jim Bianco sits down to discuss another subpar year for earnings on Bloomberg Surveillance with Tom Keene and Michael McKee.
item.itunes:keywords: business, podcasts, Tom Keene, Michael McKee, economy podcast

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Chandler: The Yen is a conundrum
item.itunes:summary: Harriman's Marc Chandler says the Japanese have lost roughly one hundred million dollars in foreign assets. He speaks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance.

item.itunes:subtitle: Duncan: No supply in low price for owned or rented property
item.itunes:summary: Fannie Mae's Douglas Duncan says the trend of house prices are moving up strongly and anticipating a five percent nominal. He speaks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance.

item.title: Peabody: Earnings will be ugly for banks in the next ten days
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Peabody: Earnings will be ugly for banks in the next ten days
item.itunes:summary: Portales Partners' Charles Peabody says earnings will be down in double digit numbers, but for the regional banks, earnings will be a bit more mixed. He speaks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance.
item.itunes:keywords: business, podcasts, Tom Keene, Michael McKee, economy podcast

item.itunes:subtitle: Nelson: Rates for big corporations are at historical lows
item.itunes:summary: Harris Williams' Ryan Nelson discusses the middle market and how rates are at a low but rising and pulling cash off the balance sheet there are little incremental cost. He speaks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance

item.title: Gray: Markets are insanely competitive
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Gray: Markets are insanely competitive

item.title: Feroli: Hopeful that the Q2 will improve

item.itunes:subtitle: Feroli: Hopeful that the Q2 will improve

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Morrison: Oil inventory in storage becomes depleted
item.itunes:summary: PWC's Reid Morrison says it takes months to bring a new oil well online and companies have not been drilling new wells so production flattens out while demand continue to increase. He speaks with Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Surveillance

item.itunes:subtitle: Levy: Currently the most housing unit construction since 1974
